content:
For example, if I want to take any record and add (or update?) a msg field:

addMsg : {}a -> {msg: Str}b
addMsg = \x ->
{x & msg: "Hello"}

Is that possible with the roc typing system?
If you want something with essentially dynamic fields at runtime, a dictionary would be required.
we've talked about adding support for this in the past, so I'd be curious what you'd be looking to use it for!
Honestly, I was just playing around with it and was curious. If I come across a concrete use case I'll let you know.

Brendan Hansknecht said:

If you want something with essentially dynamic fields at runtime, a dictionary would be required.

It still wouldn't be dynamic. It'd be closer to structural, statically typed mixins
Bennett Hoffman has marked this topic as resolved.
